remarks.remark:
Kim Ouellette’s distinguished career in real estate, which she began in Shelby Township, Michigan, in residential sales, spans over 20 years. She joins Premier Sotheby’s International Realty as the Managing Broker of the Vanderbilt office, having worked for several other prominent brokerages and having earned prestigious awards, such as Century 21’s Centurion award for the highest standard of performance and service, time and time again.

Upon coming to Naples in 2004, she joined Coldwell Banker, where she quickly earned the title of sales manager overseeing, training and coaching 100 associates. After moving to Prudential Florida WCI Realty, now Berkshire Hathaway HomeServices, in 2006 to become a managing broker of their Naples Park Shore and The Ritz-Carlton offices, she led her team to be the top-producing office out of over 40 offices for the brokerage statewide in 2015. She was also instrumental in being able to secure a second Ritz-Carlton location at The Ritz-Carlton Tiburón.

Currently, she is serving a second year as both a director for Florida REALTORS® and the Naples Area Board of REALTORS®. Having also held positions on the local board’s professional standards and function committees, Kim is currently on their legal resources committee. She holds her GRI, ABR and CRB designations and belongs to several boards, including the Women’s Council of REALTORS®.

Outside of real estate, Kim is passionate about helping and dedicating her time to others, having chaired and co-chaired for Sunshine Kids for the past 10 years, a charity that has raised several million dollars for children with cancer. As a director for her hometown college, Macomb Community College, where she earned a degree as a legal assistant, Kim proudly hosts the school’s president and his distinguished guests each year in Naples. She is married to her best friend, Ken, and they have two beautiful daughters.
